page.title: 07AN ELDERLY HAILSHAM RESIDENT
page.content: Mr Miller was born in Magham Down in 1900 and had to walk 4 miles to school at Hellingly Church. He then moved to Hailsham and went to Battle Road School. As a punishment the boys were given the cane across the wrist for talking, messing about and playing truant. He left school at 14 and worked in his parents' laundry for four years . He then married and got a job as a fireman. While he was a fireman a bomb dropped in Vicarage Field, the Post Office and everything nearby was blown up. Mr Miller did not have any hobbies when he was young he didn't join any clubs but he enjoyed playing Cricket. He told us an old wives tale: there used to be a deer paddock near the Police Station, in it there were some Peacocks and when they crowed it meant it would rain.
